title: Ticket #2711: RFE: new 'unit testing' parsable dprintf flag
description:
An idea for supporting #2675 (unit testing mode for negotiator), at least on the output side, would be a new dprintf() flag to allow requesting clean, parsable output on negotiator matches with a new logging flag exposable to configuration. For example, could be called D_UNITTEST, or perhaps D_PARSABLE, or D_MACHINE_READABLE, etc.

This would allow for requesting such output from the negotiator (or also any other daemon) in any context it was desired, as opposed to just purely unit testing.
remarks:
2011-Dec-13 16:28:35 by ziliang:
I foresee one somewhat irritating difficulty with the request. All 32bits of the debug flag variable have been spoken for. So we either need to drop an existing debug level or extend that debug flag variable to 64bits.

2011-Dec-13 17:11:44 by eje:
Todd points out (correctly) that if we would have to think carefully about exposing a machine-readable flag to customers, since that could effectively lock us into supporting a particular format.

The same might also be said of even supporting a --unit-test flag, but log output would be more ubiquitous and more likely to find its way into production pool data streams.
